method.firstStep: Boil spaghetti according to package instructions.
method.secondStep: In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
method.thirdStep: Add minced beef and cook until browned.
method.fourthStep: Stir in canned tomatoes, salt, pepper, and herbs. Simmer for 15 minutes.
method.fifthStep: Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

method.firstStep: Grill the chicken breasts until cooked through.
method.secondStep: Chop the lettuce and place it in a large bowl.
method.thirdStep: Add grilled chicken, Caesar dressing, and toss to coat.
method.fourthStep: Top with grated Parmesan cheese and croutons.

method.secondStep: Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
method.thirdStep: Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
method.fourthStep: Top with mozzarella cheese and drizzle with olive oil.
method.fifthStep: Bake for 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden and cheese is melted.
method.sixthStep: Garnish with fresh basil leaves and a pinch of salt.

ingredients.onion: 1 medium white onion, finely chopped (about 1 1/2 c.)

method.firstStep: In a medium pot over medium-high heat, heat broth until steaming. Reduce heat to low, cover, and keep warm.
method.secondStep: Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, melt 4 tablespoons butter. Add onion and 1/2 teaspoon salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, translucent, and sweet to the taste, 8 to 10 minutes. Add rice and cook, stirring occasionally, until translucent around the edges, 1 to 2 minutes more.
method.thirdStep: Add wine and cook, stirring, until liquid is absorbed, 3 to 4 minutes. Add 3 cups warm broth, stir to incorporate, and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is just tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
method.fourthStep: Uncover and add 1/2 cup warm broth. Return to a simmer over medium heat and continue to cook, stirring, until broth is absorbed, 1 to 2 minutes more. Taste and, if rice is still slightly al dente, add remaining 1/2 cup broth and continue to simmer, stirring, until absorbed and rice is tender.
method.fifthStep: Remove from heat. Stir in Parmesan, pepper, and remaining 1 tablespoon butter until cheese and butter are melted; season with remaining 2 teaspoons salt, if needed. Serve immediately.
